com.github.fge.jsonschema.processing

Class ProcessingCache<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.fge.jsonschema.processing.ProcessingCache<K,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - the type of (wrapped) keys for this cache
    V - the type of values retrieved by this cache
    Deprecated. 
    use CachingProcessor instead

    @ThreadSafe
@Deprecated
public final class ProcessingCache<K,V>
extends Object
    A processing result cache usable in Processors

    This is a wrapper over Guava's LoadingCache to which you pass two arguments:

    • an Equivalence on cache keys,
    • a CacheLoader to load keys.

    Note that the cache loader must throw a ProcessingException or any subclass.

    You can of course use Guava's builtin equivalences if you don't wish (or need) to write your own:

    • Equivalence.equals() for the classical equals/hashcode key comparison,
    • Equivalence.identity() for a reference equality comparison (useful if you use enums or classes as keys, for instance).

    Note that there is one major difference with Guava's caches: this cache does not accept null keys.

    See Also:
    LoadingCache, Equivalence, Equivalence.Wrapper

      • getUnchecked

        public V getUnchecked(K key)
        Deprecated. 
        Get an entry from the cache, "ignoring" exceptions

        Exceptions are not really ignored per se. You can use this method instead of get(Object) if you are sure that no exceptions can be thrown.

        If an exception is thrown nevertheless, it will be an unchecked exception.

        Parameters:
        key - the key
        Returns:
        the matching value
        Throws:
        ProcessingError - key is null
